snippet: The recent shareholder challenges to excessive executive pay are only a start. It’s time that all parts of the Dodd-Frank reform law be carried out.
abstract: Editorial criticizes the Securities and Exchange Commission for not yet putting into effect, nearly two years after passage of the Dodd-Frank reform law, the pay-gap provision that requires companies to calculate and disclose the ratio of the chief executive's compensation to company's median pay package.
lead_paragraph: The recent shareholder challenges to excessive executive pay are only a start. It’s time that all parts of the Dodd-Frank reform law be carried out.

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
